Gadaikan Sertifikat Rumah Korban untuk Bayar Utang, 2 Wanita Ditangkap
04 Nov 2019, 22:08 by Samsudhuha Wildansyah
Jakarta - Seorang wanita berinisial W dan notaris berinisial N ditangkap karena menggadaikan sertifikat rumah korban seharga Rp 4,5 M. Tersangka berpura-pura hendak membeli rumah korban hingga akhirnya menggadaikan sertifikatnya.
Kasus penipuan itu terjadi pada Mei 2019 lalu. Saat itu tersangka W berperan berpura-pura ingin membeli sebuah rumah di wilayah Jakarta Selatan milik korbannya.
"Peran W dia itu pura-pura sebagai pembeli. Ada seseorang korban yang akan jual rumah kemudian pelaku datang berpura-pura sebagai pembeli. Dengan berbagai upaya, cara dia komunikasi dan penjual rumah ini tertarik atau pun dia percaya," kata Kabid Humas Polda Metro Jaya Kombes Argo Yuwono di Polda Metro Jaya, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).
Cara meyakinkan korbannya, tersangka W memberikan uang muka sebesar Rp 150 juta ke korban. Dengan uang muka itu, korban merasa yakin dengan tersangka dan menyerahkan sertifikat itu ke tersangka N yang juga sebagai notaris.
"Dia percaya karena pelaku memberikan DP sekitar Rp 150 juta padahal rumah yang dijual Rp 4,5 miliar," jelas Argo.
Tersangka N disebut Argo merupakan notaris asli, namun bertugas di Cianjur bukan di Jakarta Selatan. Tersangka N kedapatan membantu tersangka W dalam aksinya.
"Setelah dilakukan cek, ricek ternyata sertifikat sudah diberikan ke pihak ke-3, digadaikan. Kenapa bisa seperti itu, makannya pelapor nggak terima dan dirugikan," kata Argo.
Singkat cerita, tersangka W yang berhasil mendapatkan sertifikat rumah korban lalu menggadaikan sertifikat itu ke orang lain. Kasubdit Harda Ditreskrimum Polda Metro Jaya, Kompol M Gafur menyebut tersangka W menggadaikan sertifikat itu ke orang lain dengan tujuan untuk membayar utang-utangnya.
"Jadi dia sudah ada utang ke orang lain kemudian dia lunasi utangnya dengan memberikan sertifikat orang lain. Sertifikat belum balik nama tapi orang tersebut percaya karena ada PPJB mutlak di situ," kata Gafur.
Gafur menyebut tersangka W memiliki utang sebesar Rp 26 miliar. Tersangka W disebutnya menggadaikan 2 sertifikat korban dengan total kerugian korban mencapai Rp 4,5 miliar.
Polisi masih mengusut kasus tersebut termasuk menyelidiki peran tersangka N. Tersangka N diduga ikut berperan dalam kasus yang sama dengan tersangka-tersangka yang lebih dulu ditangkap polisi.
"Ini akan kita dalami yang jelas notaris ini ada kaitan dengan perkara yang sudah kita proses dan sudah kita limpahkan ke kejaksaan," kata Gafur.
"Setelah dilakukan penangkapan ini dilakukan penelusuran digital forensik, hp semua profiling ternyata ada hubungan dengan sindikat yang sudah kita serahkan ke jaksa," sambungnya.
Atas perbuatannya, para tersangka dikenakan Pasal 372 KUHP. Para tersangka terancam hukuman 4 tahun penjara.

(sam/mea)

Mortgaged Victims' House Certificate to Pay Debt, 2 Women Arrested
Nov 04 2019, 22:08 by Samsudhuha Wildansyah
Jakarta - A woman with the initial W and a notary with the initial N is arrested for mortgaging the victim's house certificate for Rp. 4.5 billion. The suspect pretends to buy the victim's house and finally pawns the certificate.
The fraud case occurred in May 2019. At that time the suspect W played a role pretending to buy a house in the South Jakarta area owned by his victim.
"The role of W is pretending to be a buyer. There is a victim who will sell the house, then the perpetrator comes to pretend to be a buyer. With various efforts, the way he communicates and the seller of the house is interested or he believes," said Metro Police Head of Public Relations. Jaya Kombes Argo Yuwono at the Jakarta Metropolitan Police, Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019).
How to convince the victims, the suspect W gave an advance of Rp 150 million to the victim. With the down payment, the victim felt confident with the suspect and handed the certificate over to suspect N who was also a notary.
"He believes because the perpetrators gave a DP of around Rp. 150 million even though the house sold was Rp. 4.5 billion," Argo explained.
Suspect N, called Argo, is an original notary, but he is working in Cianjur, not in South Jakarta. Suspect N was found to be assisting W in his action.
"After checking, re-check turns out that the certificate has been given to the 3rd party, mortgaged. Why can it be like that, so the reporter did not accept and was harmed," Argo said.
Long story short, the suspect W who managed to get the victim's house certificate then mortgaged the certificate to someone else. Kasubdit Harda Ditreskrimum of the Jakarta Police, Kompol M Gafur said the suspect W mortgaged the certificate to someone else with the aim of paying his debts.
"So he has a debt to someone else then he repays his debt by giving someone else's certificate. The certificate has not yet been given the name but the person believes because there is an absolute PPJB there," said Gafur.
Gafur said the suspect W had a debt of Rp 26 billion. The suspect W is said to have mortgaged two victims' certificates with a total loss of Rp 4.5 billion.
The police are still investigating the case, including investigating the role of suspect N. Suspect N is suspected to have played a role in the same case as the suspects who were first arrested by the police.
"We will explore this notary clearly that there is a connection with the case that we have processed and we have delegated to the prosecutor's office," said Gafur.
"After this arrest was made forensic digital searches, all profiling cellphones turned out to have a connection with the syndicate that we had submitted to the prosecutor," he continued.
For their actions, the suspects are subject to Article 372 of the Criminal Code. The suspects are facing a sentence of 4 years in prison.

(sam / mea)
